Text: .@ARKInvest’s confidence in $AAPL’s #AutonomousVehicle strategy has gone down based on its LiDAR focus, which #Tesla considers a crutch in an #AI model that is more deterministic than probabilistic, and we agree.

Investors should think in years. Like if I buy Tesla or Apple today. Where will they be in 5 years? All the stocks I own are about the future and none are perfect. But you build a portfolio and basically hold them for the long term. It’s pretty simple actually. $tsla $aapl
Apple can’t make a charging mat. Tesla is rolling out FSD hardware for an autonomous EV car.  The pace of innovation at Tesla is amazing. At Apple it’s a rush to get to lunch. $aapl vs $tsla

$AAPL is canceling its actual product innovations but releasing a credit card and going into mortgages. Steve Jobs would be livid and would have absolutely never let this product cancellation happen like this, publicly.

Here's what people are missing about Apple: no other company--or country--has the clout to pull off what they are doing: extracting profits from others to benefit its customers at very little cost. $AAPL
more fake news and propaganda than you can possibly read? ...for ten bucks a month? Count me in! $AAPL
